criteria: Application of Knowledge to Real-Life Scenarios
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of research-based guidelines for healthy snacks.
Shows a minimal understanding of research-based guidelines with significant misconceptions.
Displays a basic understanding of some research-based guidelines but lacks depth.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of research-based guidelines for selecting healthy snacks.
Exhibits a strong understanding of research-based guidelines, accurately identifying key components.
Shows a comprehensive and nuanced understanding of research-based guidelines, including the ability to critically evaluate them.
Unable to identify any healthy snacks based on provided information.
Identifies very few healthy snacks, with many incorrect choices.
Identifies some healthy snacks, but also includes unhealthy options.
Accurately identifies most healthy snacks based on research-based guidelines.
Consistently identifies healthy snacks and can explain why they are considered healthy.
Demonstrates the ability to identify healthy snacks in diverse and complex scenarios, justifying choices with detailed explanations.
Unable to apply knowledge of healthy snacks to real-life scenarios.
Struggles to apply knowledge and makes poor choices in real-life scenarios.
Applies knowledge inconsistently, with some appropriate choices and some poor choices.
Generally applies knowledge effectively in real-life scenarios.
Consistently applies knowledge of healthy snacks in real-life scenarios, making informed and healthy choices.
Proactively applies knowledge in real-life scenarios, adapting strategies to different contexts and demonstrating a commitment to healthy eating.
